result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
copy of information provided to counsel. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Bail motion heard. State opposes and modification of bail. Court denies bail motion.

1:16 PM Defendant Joslyn Amber Perl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Joslyn Amber Perl.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify. Waiver form on file. Court examines defendant, accepts said waiver and binds matter for trial. State informs.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
TO modify bond with court date of 8/30 @ 1 pm filed by Atty Boaz (efiled @ 12:56 pm)
Atty Boaz to file Bail motion to be heard 8/30/22 at 1pm

8:46 AM Defendant Joslyn Amber Perl appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she has submitted a request to speak with the public defender a few days ago and hasn't met with them yet. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joslyn Amber Perl appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court appearing as a friend of the court for Joslyn Amber Perl. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation.  Counsel advises Defendant is on a probation hold. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State requesting $1000 cash bail with conditions. Court finds good cause to waive time limits and set case for status on prelim hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
